p: The proteasome inhibition for anticancer therapy, particularly by natural compounds, has produced distinct and promising outcomes of cancer treatment. The use of a proteasome inhibitor might be an effective strategy in the treatment of skin cancer. Inula viscosa (L.) Aiton (Compositae) is a medicinal plant distributed in different regions of the Mediterranean Basin. Therefore, the plant has been used in traditional medicine for treatment of different diseases, including cancer treatment. In vivo studies showed that Inula viscosa extracts inhibit the development of skin carcinoma induced by DMBA in the mouse. Docking studies showed that Inula viscosa extract contains bioactive molecules with a much greater proteasome inhibition potentials than the chemically synthesized inhibitors and could be better new candidates in targeted therapy against skin carcinoma.
